DataElement.preferredName: Esophageal Neoplasm Clinical AJCC Edition 8 M Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the distant metastasis of the malignant neoplasm involving the esophagus based on  information obtained from the date of cancer diagnosis until the start of definitive treatment, or within four months (whichever is shorter), using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant neoplasm involving the esophagus._Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant neoplasm involving the esophagus.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm involving the esophagus.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  M refers to the presence of metastasis.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 6/22/20 jk Released per SME (NGM) review and approval email.  6/10/20 jk created for CPTAC ESCA Baseline CRF - generalized AJCC level.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Carcinoma American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 M Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of esophagus and esophagogastric junction cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. This staging system applies to carcinomas including squamous cell carcinoma, adenocarcinoma, adenosquamous carcinoma, undifferentiated carcinoma, neuroendocrine cancers, and adenocarcinoma with neuroendocrine features. Sarcomas, nonepithelial cancers, and gastrointestinal stromal tumors are not staged using this staging system. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)_One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
